answers.text: In brief:   It depends   It depends of your country and the state of coronavirus, in some places you need to have traveled recently to another country to get the test, and in another countrys you need to be tested right away after any symptoms.   You should check your country  phase of coronavirus  Would you like to video or text chat with me?         Dr. Angel Carrasco        Send ›          Dr. Angel Carrasco        Send ›
answers.doctor name: Dr. Angel Carrasco General Practice

question: Should I be tested for COVID-19? I have a cough and phlegm on my chest as well as headaches. I always get colds and flu that affect my chest

answers.text: Yes. Avoid contact but ensure that they have food, supplies and able to slay at home. They should drink fluids and if they develop a fever, please call your PCP right away and also consider a virtual appointment with HT. Other symptoms to watch for include dry cough and shortness of breath. Use good hand washing and disinfect surfaces.
answers.doctor name: Dr. Amrita Dosanjh, UC San Diego School of Medicine

question: Should I really be worried about my elderly parents catching COVID-19? What steps should they take to stay healthy?

answers.text: In brief:   Same measures    Wear a mask, social distance as possible, try not to touch surfaces, keep hands clean.   Best would still be not to travel if possible.  Would you like to video or text chat with me?         Dr. Silviu Pasniciuc                 Send ›          Dr. Silviu Pasniciuc                 Send ›
answers.doctor name: Dr. Silviu Pasniciuc Internal Medicine

question: How can I avoid catching COVID-19 if I have to travel by plane or public transportation?

answers.text: Current symptoms? You may have experienced Coronavirus infection. Please stay at home until well and without any signs of illness. Drink fluids, rest and monitor your temperature. .
answers.doctor name: Dr. Amrita Dosanjh, UC San Diego School of Medicine

question: I am a little concerned that I may be showing some symptoms for Coronavirus. I have had a bit of a dry cough about 2 weeks ago for 3 days. A week later I had a headache and got nauseaus. I never get headaches. My chest has felt unusual for 5 days.

answers.text: Take all precautions. Take all precautions possible to try to avoid catching Coronavirus. Wash your hands often with soap & water, avoid touching your eyes, nose & mouth, stay home as much as possible, cover your mouth & nose with tissue if you sneeze or cough, clean & disinfect  frequently touched surfaces often & if you have fever, cough and difficulty breathing seek medical care.
answers.doctor name: Dr. Harold Mandel, Jefferson Medical College of Thomas Jefferson University

question: I have type 1 diabetes and to put it simply, I am living in an anxious state right now, worrying constantly about the coronavirus. My wife is a practice nurse in a GP surgery, and I worry constantly about the risk for us both. I am so scared.

answers.text: In brief:   Stay home   Stay home for at least 7 days, rest, drink fluids and monitor your temperature.   There is an overlap between flu and COVID-19 symptoms. Nasal congestion and absence of fever are not typically associated with COVID.  Would you like to video or text chat with me? answers.text: In brief:   Being cautious best   Any medication that can increase the potential of viral infections should be avoided during a coronavirus outbreak such as we are seeing now. question: If Allegra use is associated with increased risk of viral infections, isn't it dangerous to take it during the coronavirus pandemic?

answers.text: Hard to say. In the absence of treatment I guess we grasp at things. This is definitely doing the rounds but as yet unproven. Most people recover from covid. So very very hard to trial. Most important right now is not to spread it. So stay home. Wash hands.
answers.doctor name: Dr. Claudine Nandi Lee, University of Pretoria Faculty of Medicine

answers.text: Looks promising. The hydroxychloroquine  has been in use as a safe preventive for malaria since the 1940's with some side effects in some patients. Zithromax was approved in 1995 & used extensively since. Regulatory agencies seek a 2 pronged approach to approval for use. First is safety, which these have and then effectiveness. I believe it is worth trying for those infected given the success of pilot studies.
answers.doctor name: Dr. James Ferguson, University of Texas Medical Branch School of Medicine

question: I have had a sore throat for a few days, Tuesday Night it felt like tonsils, Yesterday it started becoming scratchy and today I have started coughing and spitting mucus. I do not have a fever, But I get light headed here and there, could it be Covid?

question: I have had a sore throat for a few days, Tuesday Night it felt like tonsils, Yesterday it started becoming scratchy and today I have started coughing and spitting mucus. I do not have a fever, But i get light headed here and there, could it be Covid-?

answers.text: Diabetes + Covid-19. Because you are a Type I diabetic it means that you are at greater risk for complications if you contract Covid-19. If you have had a sore throat for a few days that gets worse every day, and if you have a fever over 100F, call your General Physician. .
answers.doctor name: Dr. Arnold Malerman, Maurice H. Kornberg School of DentistryÂ (Temple University)

question: Because I have type 1 diabetes, does that mean I can’t get the virus just mildly? Am I likely to have severe complications? Please help.

answers.text: Isolate. No symptoms no test. You really do not need testing if there are no symptoms, but act like  you are contagious. avoid contact with people for 14 days and only consult your GP if get symptoms.
answers.doctor name: Dr. Barend jacobus Stander

question: If one has been in contact with a COVID-19 positive person in the last 12-day, but am asymptomatic, what should one do to confirm if the virus has been or not contracted? Don’t think it is responsible to wait till symptoms manifest

answers.text: Probable flu. This definitely sounds like Influenza is starting.( Unless you have any obvious reason to suspect COVID-19,Malaria,Tick Bite Fever or Glandular Fever).Rest,Vitamin C and a suitable over the counter painkiller. I would advise avoiding Ibuprofen and other Non-Steroidal Anti-Inflammatory medication.
answers.doctor name: Dr. Gavin h Zipp, University of the Witwatersrand

question: On and off fever, sore body?

question: Do I have covid 19?

answers.text: Diabetes + Covid-19. Have you been diagnosed as a Diabetic, or just someone with slightly elevated A1C? Reports are that diabetics, especially males, are at greater risk. Follow all precautions that have been posted all over the internet and have been printed in newspapers. If you have a sore throat and a fever, call your General Physician and follow his/her directions completely.

question: My hba1c is not as good as it should be. Am I more likely to die of the virus? I’m so scared. I have type 1 diabetes. Please help.

question: I have a sore throat, a slight cough as well as slightly dry eyes. I may have been in contact with individuals with COVID-19 but unknowingly?

answers.text: Watch and wait. With very mild symptoms you do not need to be tested.Your temperature is important. if your symptoms worsen or a fever develops or you start coughing and shortness of breath you need to seek help. stay home and treat the symptoms with paracetamol.
answers.doctor name: Dr. Barend jacobus Stander

question: I have very mild symptoms of covid 19. Headache, sore throat, fatigue. What do I do now? Is it advised to rather stay home, or go to get tested?

answers.text: Covid and TB. Patients with a history of underlying lung disease do have a higher risk of morbidity and mortality with covid infection. It is important to self isolate and maintain social distancing as per the current protocols. Should you suspect covid infection get screened as early as possible.

Keep bags outside and sterilize everything coming into your home - entire item. KEep using this forum for questions. :)

question: I am a 46 year old female. I've had Trach for the last 9 months due to stridor, bronchospasm and larageal spasms. I am currently being worked up for autoimmune disease. I am on Xoliar am I more susceptible to coronavirus?

answers.text: Infectious for 3w. If you had corona virus you are infectious for 3 weeks. So you need to stay 2 m away from loved ones. Stay home. Get someone else to shop for you. Stay home. Wear a buff over your nose and mouth. Do not touch your face, mouth or nose. Wash hands for 20 seconds every 20 min.

question: I was severely sick with a cough back in mid February before I knew about the current virus. Not sure if I had a fever or not. I'd cough so hard and vomit. I smoke. Could I still have coronavirus antibodies?
